info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 2:28PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Salt Lake and central Davis Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Syracuse, or 8 miles southwest of Hill Air Force Base, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Layton, Farmington, Kaysville, Syracuse, Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway, West Point and Antelope Island State Park. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds and half inch hail on the Great Salt Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
